title: "Why does hypnotic fascination often lead to amnesia? Learn about the technique in this book"
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses why hypnotic fascination can result in amnesia. This extract is from the book "Instant Hypnosis and Fascination," which provides powerful techniques for creating states of focused concentration. The author references various historical figures, including Lorenzo de' Medici, Giordano Bruno, and Virgil, who have used similar techniques to captivate their audiences. Additionally, the author cites modern research on the physiological effects of prolonged eye contact and explores the importance of the first four minutes of a conversation in establishing interpersonal connections. They note that while most modern hypnosis techniques rely on spoken word, there is value in exploring non-verbal methods as well.
